definitions.definition: To tell lies , exaggerate ; to mislead ; to deceive .
examples: I think you’re bullshitting . Let’s just call your office and see if you even came in.
You’re bullshitting me. I called your office and you never even came in.

definitions.definition: To have casual conversation with no real point; to shoot the breeze .
examples: I will probably just go and bullshit with Joe for a while.

definitions.definition: To come up with on the spot ; to improvise .
examples: We just went on stage and bullshitted the whole concert because we didn’t know any songs.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive , vulgar , slang ) To tell lies , exaggerate ; to mislead ; to deceive .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , vulgar , slang ) To have casual conversation with no real point; to shoot the breeze .
( intransitive , vulgar , slang ) To come up with on the spot ; to improvise .
